talmud.text: Who is strong? He who subdues his passions.
If you add to the truth, you subtract from it.
Excellent is wisdom when associated with an inheritance.
God could not be everywhere, so therefore he made mothers.
God is merciful to those who are merciful to others.
A word is worth one coin; silence is worth two.
The unlearned lose the power of clear thinking as they grow old, but scholars gain in it as their years advance.
A scholar takes precedence over a king of Israel, for if a scholar dies, there is none to replace him; while if a king of Israel dies, all Israel are eligible for kingship.
A sage is jealous of another sage, but not of one unlearned in his subject.
Who is rich? He who rejoices in his portion.
Why was man created on the sixth day? To teach that if he is ever swrollen with pride, it can be said to him: A flea came ahead of thee in creation.
The proverb runs: How great that man would be were he not so arrogant.
Judgment delayed is judgment voided.
Do not judge your fellow man until you have stood in his place.
For the unlearned, old age is a winter; for the learned it is the season of the harvest.
Every blade of grass has its Angel that bends over it and whispers, "Grow, grow."
Better is he who gives little to charity from money honestly earned, than he who gives much from dishonestly gained wealth.
Even a poor man who lives on charity should give charity.
Rabbi Akiba said: "Everything is foreseen, yet freedom is given; the world is judged by grace, yet all is according to the amount of good works."
He who hath compassion upon others receives compassion from Heaven.
Let no man ask what had been before creation of the world.
A man cannot say to the Angel of Death: I wish to arrange my affairs before I die.
Good deeds are better than wise sayings.
Thy friend has a friend, and thy friend's friend has a friend; be discreet.
Teach thy tongue to say, "I do not know."
If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat; and if thirsty, give him water to drink. Even if he came to kill you, give him food if he is hungry or water if he is thirsty.
Jealousy, passion, vanity drive one out of the world.
A man does not hurt his finger unless it is decreed from above.
It is fitting for a great God to forgive great sinners.
You must forgive those who transgress against you before you can look to forgiveness from Above.
Just as the larger fish in the sea swallow the smaller, so also is it with men. If not for the fear of government, the stronger would swallow the weaker.
God says to man: "With thy very wounds I will heal thee."
God wants the heart.
Whoever humbles himself, God elevates him; whoever is proud, God brings him down. Whoever runs after honors, honors run away from him.
We do not see things as they are, we see things as we are.
Never greet a stranger in the night, for he may be a demon.
The man who asks mercy for another while both are in peril will be answered first.
Better an ounce from the ground than a pound from the roof.
Sheep follow sheep.
A person is led on the path that he truly wants to travel on.
Join the company of lions rather than assume the lead among foxes.
